subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... Not gN but Ng . ... That s trickier.  The CMU version of -ed is  IH0 D , but you have to also verify that the Orthodox version actually does end in
messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> I realize there is a third possibility, that I first convert words like
> "jumping" to QS, so it would look like "JampiN." Then I replace the
> pattern "iN" with "N." Likewise, I can replace the pattern "IN" with
> "N," and "gN" with N. I guess that would be the best way.

Not "gN" but "Ng".

> How about the "ed" endings? Should these all be changed to "d"?

That's trickier. The CMU version of "-ed" is " IH0 D", but you have to
also verify that the Orthodox version actually does end in "-ed" and not
"-id" (such as "arachnid"). Furthermore, the preceding letter must not be
"D", or "loaded" will become Low-Owe-Day-Day.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
C'est la` pourtant que se livre le sens du dire, de ce que, s'y conjuguant
le nyania qui bruit des sexes en compagnie, il supplee a ce qu'entre eux,
de rapport nyait pas. -- Jacques Lacan, "L'Etourdit"
